caption: Best restaurant experience I've had! The chef personally greets you for sit down or pick up and is very kind. Very authentic food and experience. I highly recommend the escargots (taste like squid), the steak, and the cheese plate. So much flavor packed in each bite. Thank you!!
Wonderful cuisine and lovely service.
Inimitable

Exceptional food and customer service at Le Petite Paris!  Stayed at the Ritz-Carlton which is a 4 minute walk from this remarkable gem.  Due to Covid-19 restrictions, we orderd and picked up.  The Chef was extremely accommodating offering items I requested that were not on the menu and the food was superb- Filet w Peppercorns, Steak Frites, Cheese Platters, Truffle Sauce.,. He even waited to plate our hot vs cold food until we arrived so that it would be perfect and IT WAS!  I wish that I would have ordered the escargot pastry but forgot.  When covid restrictions are over for indoor dining- I will be driving in from the suburbs with a group and take one of everything!  Amazing 👏
french food, mmm, delicious. Came here on a Saturday. Service treated us so kindly. This place has a nice atmosphere.
Our favorite go to for special occasions! The best french food with the best chef, surroundings and staff.  Our favorite restaurant!
We love this place! It is cozy and old world charming. The French cuisine is wonderful!
One of my fav spots for quality french food. i will be back with my relatives. this place has an awesome atmosphere.
The food was EXCELLENT and the owner was fantastic. Easily one of the best hidden gems in the city. The prices are the lowest I’ve ever seen at this quality of restaurant anywhere.
One of my fav locations for french food. I had a brother come into town and asked me to take him back here. Prices were appropriate. Not so close to my office, unfortunately.
First time visiting this restaurant, excellent food at a reasonable price.
french food here - very tasty. I often meet people here to talk. The staff was very helpful and welcoming. Bring your hunger - portions are large. Kinda of like a place in Houston that I enjoyed.
Hidden gem. Amazing food and old school charm.
french food and the setting at this location is super good. The service was very kind and attentive. Food is similar to a cafe in Portland I liked.

Lovely experience even if the place is a bit dated and somewhat dark. The food was good and the service, though perhaps a bit quirky, good as well.  Loved the authentic French cuisine that was straightforward and not haughty.
It is the best French food in Chicago!!

I celebrated my PhD yesterday in this great restaurant. Well we had a outstanding evening and the venue was no doubt one of the reasons for this strong meeting. The crew  participated in a pleasant manner, the cuisine was yummy and my guests were extremely  cheerful. We shall no dout return for more celebrations. thanks very much.
This is one of the best restaurants in the U.S. Alan is amazing and his food is world class!!

last night was the first time we visited this magnificent restaurant. But It is definitely not the last time. We enjoyed the evening very much with the good service, with the fine  dishes and fine drinks and with the honest cost. We will no doubt go back there soon.
I just like their dishes. I always get fantastic service there. The place is neat and the staff members are always helpful. Will come visit again.
Excellent food for a very decent price. Just play along with the waiter and you'll be fine. He'll make some weird jokes but just be nice and you won't have problems.
I really enjoy their food. I always get great customer service there. The place is clean and the cashiers are always helpful. Will come back again.

Do not give this place your time or money. The owner was beyond rude to us for no reason. He told us to never come back. What owner of a restaurant tells someone to never come back. Extremely disappointing!
Had a good experience in this spot with my son. The food came rapidly and the service is just excellent. Prices are reasonable.
The food is consistently well prepared and yummy, staff members gives good service. I really like how clean it is and atmosphere. Keep up the good work.

This restaurant is my number one place.  Of all restaurants I know I love it most. I never miss an opportunity to go to this restaurant. when  I I need a delicious supper, this is the place that comes first to my head. excellent and all kinds of  food and a large menu.well mannered staff, and good spirit. Not less important, the cost is decent. I tell about this place with great pleasure.

I sent my friends to this place with my warmest recommendations. I go their often. I get very good feedback from my friends. The the cooking is yummy and the crew is generous and cooperative. always when we visit this place we enjoy a pleasing time.  I recommend this place with pleasure.
This spot constantly delivers. They serve good food for reasonable rates, there is no waiting time even when they are loaded.
Fantastic place to get something when in a hurry. The service is prompt, rates are reasonable, awesome character. Would recommend to others

Terrible experience! I usually give places the benefit of the doubt before I reject them, but all the other reviews were accurate. The owner Alain was extremely rude and dismissive. I had a reservation through open table and he totally dismissed it. Said that I didn’t have one and basically kicked me out. Don’t waste your money. Avoid this place!

Wow, what a bizarre experience. Long, but true story. After a few hours at the MCA, my wife and I decided to try this cute sounding french restaurant a 5 minute walk away. Google says it opens at 5:00. We got there at 5:00, door locked, dark inside. We waited a few minutes thinking they might be just running a little late. At about 5:10 I call, and a frenchman answers to tell me they'll open "about 5:30." We decide to wait. Finally at 5:30 the doors are unlocked and we walk in. A French waiter "greeted" us rather coldly, and sat us in the far, far back of an empty restaurant. In hindsight, it's telling that his first question was "Do you live in the building." (it's located on the 1st floor of a high-rise apartment building) When I said "No, we're just doing a fun day trip in the city" . . . Game over.  From that point forward, at every chance he could, he was very rude and condescending. To the point of absurdity. Like he was auditioning for the role of "rude French waiter." And the oddest part was how over-the-top charming he was with others who began to straggle in. They seemed to be regulars who presumably live in the neighborhood, and for them he adopted a strange saccharine charisma. It was very weird. I felt like we were in a David Lynch movie, or maybe being punked by some hidden camera show. I should point out  that we'd been in a good mood and were polite and respectful to him -- after all, we were trying to have fun on our special day in the city — but he was the opposite. For some reason, he seemed to decide we weren't worth his time and trouble. The result was this kind of sad, icky feeling we had as we drove home. The food was truly delectable, so there's that. I guess, if you don't live in the neighborhood, consider lying. It might be your only way to get decent service. I can't think of any other explanation for what we saw and experienced.
This spot is worth trying. They have big portions for reasonable prices. Consistently clean and with good character. Will come back again.

This place is amazing. A hidden gem. Our table had corn soup, onion soup, cheese plate to start. For mains we had steak frites and gnocchi. Everything was delicious. The owner is so nice and accommodating. I will definitely be back to try the rest of the menu.

I wish I had an option for no stars. Very disappointed in the way the person behind the call handled my reservation. I asked for 8:30 pm he said no because his kitchen closes at that time even though the post says 10 pm closing. He said he’ll accommodate an earlier time, before 8:30. So I suggested 8, 7:30, 7 and he blatantly said “no no, no reservations-as if he just changed his mind. Then said “Call tomorrow!” He was eager to get off the phone. I was going to make reservation for tomorrow instead he kept saying “no no no!” Then hung up!  I lived in the building for over 2 years and this would’ve been our first dining experience at la petit. We were so disappointed! Would not suggest anyone to go if this how they treat their potential customers. 👎🏽
Damn good food, wine and service!
Just succulent French cuisine and great prices.
The food was excellent and service outstanding! Highly recommended if you desire an intimate meal in a warm and welcoming setting. Greatly appreciated the birthday chorus for my teenage daughter!

(Translated by Google) Very good food service fast boss very attentive prices very correct nothing to say perfect I recommend  (Original) Très bonne cuisine service rapide patron très attentionné prix très correctes  rien à dire parfait je conseille
Horrible greasy food, gloomy depressing ambience, rude unprofessional service and absolutely disgusting behavior on the owner/manager makes it officially the worst restaurant in Chicago right now.
Good food good place for an intimate dinner or a friendly meal

Well, what a stereotypical French experience that was!  Beautiful food in a quirky little restaurant owned by a Frenchman who was direct to the point of being rude.  We arrived just after 8.30pm on a Friday and decided fairly quickly on our order.  Unfortunately the French onion soup was not available and, as we didn’t want any of the other starters we said we’d go straight to mains, as we had our eye on the cheeseboard, instead of desserts.  My wife asked for the boeuf bourguignon - no beef bourguignon.  Duck?  No canard.  Lamb?  Oui.  I tentatively asked for the calves liver.  Oui.  (Thank god!)  My wife let out a small yeeaayy and was promptly told off as “we were late and that’s why all the fresh food had gone”.  I did not escape his disdain either, as I had ordered a Diet Coke instead of the obligatory French red wine.  “You are not drinking? Pfffttt!”  “No” I said, and muttering “sorry(!)”  Before the food came out he suddenly appeared at the table to tell us that the food was nearly ready as he had started to cook it immediately we ordered.  We thanked him profusely for the update, even though we were sure we had not shown any signs of impatience.  Luckily the food was really nice; although he said we wouldn’t need any sides, when really the portion sizes required at least one each.  The waiter then asked if we wanted to look at the desserts menu, but the owner butted in and told him that we wanted the cheeseboard and to bring more dry white bread.  Again the cheese was nice but there could have been more for the $9  The final act of brusqueness was when we spotted that he had added $71 and $7 and got $77 and he thought we were disagreeing with the bill and came over to ask “is there something wrong with the bill?”  We meekly said “No, it’s fine”, paid and left.
Delightfully offbeat.  Very good food and very good prices.  A decided throwback in time to a different dining style and room.
A favorite place for quality French food. i'll return family next time. makes me feel like i am back in tucson.
french food... so tasty. came in on a thurs. bring your appetite because portions are large. ambience reminds me of colorado springs area.
French food, mmm, so tasty. i will be back with my coworkers. i see why this place has a lot of positive reviews.
There is something wrong with the owner, Allan.  He must have some type of mental disorder.  He's off the scale rude -and for no reason.  Very bizarre.

Quaint, almost time warpish, tucked away, little place. Feels like Faulty Towers a bit but simple & incredibly good French bistro-style food. The tiny bar is a delight as well with an ancient TV in the corner (probably never used) and a phenomenal jukebox loaded with classics from the 1940s & 1950s. The owner will probably be your waiter as well offering excellent order suggestions. We've been there a dozen times and never been disappointed.
Great food, very reasonable prices for downtown Chicago.  Highly recommended!

Shame on you, Allan. I still cannot believe, this man named Allan, the owner of this restaurant can be this rude. He was not only rude, but also racist. We made the reservation before we came to the restaurant. There were empty seats, but the owner just let me and my friend’s family standing in the middle of the hallway for so long. So that finally we decided to leave. When we were leaving, he just broke out of the door and came to us, yelled “never come back!” Such an uneducated, ridiculous, impolite man.
Delicious French fare
Great food and experience
My preferred scene for french food. Got there near seven, it wasn't very crowded. Will surely make a return trip. It has a cool atmosphere.

I love the relaxed ambience of this place – like dining at a friends home. Alain, the owner/chef is always  welcoming and warm, he is part of the reason why I keep going back. He is personable and loves to see his guests enjoying the food. This time I tried the potato leek soup and it was amazing. The service was excellent and wines are affordable.
My favorite location for delicious french food. It's so tasty. Service treated us so nice. Prices that won't break you.
A top spot for delicious French food. service is awesome even when they are busy. looking forward to coming back with my relatives. it has a nice atmosphere.
Exelent,food.Romantic place.and Good.service.ok
Wonderful hidden Gem.  Everything is expertly prepared a nd delicious.
Good food
Order the frog legs and ask the owner for recommendations!
Great place near Water Tower.  The food is great.  A small place with great food and very affordable wine.

Wish I would have listened to the other reviews about the rude owner. We got out in the cold, took buses and walked to get there but found the door locked. The doorman at the building suggested we knock as they should be open (we arrived 30 minutes after posted opening time). We were greeted by an annoyed gentleman that asked if we had a reservation and told us to come back half an hour later. We went to Mitey Nice a couple blocks down and enjoyed a 5 star and cheerful dinner there instead.  Heard this place was a hidden gem. But maybe there's a reason it stays hidden.

NEVER AGAIN!  Once viewed this place as a hidden gem; not anymore. I had made reservations.  We were seated promptly.  Owner very put off we did not order wine.  We ordered salads, entrees, coffee and 3 of the 4 of us had desserts; I did not have a dessert.  Owner told the table they should leave me behind next time, I guess since I didn’t order dessert.  Seating is tight.  Got banged in the back of the chair numerous times by the owner passing by.  The food was fine but not worth the abuse.  Just not a pleasant dining experience.
Terrific french onion soup.

The best place in Chicago. In a city where you have to wait a life to be attended. This kind of human service is more than noticed. Y will recomend this place always, this guys made me feel more than confortable... cared and loved.
This is a wonderful place! The food, the value, the ambiance and Alain make this a GREAT dining experience. The service is timely and expert.
Absolutely one of the best restaurants in the city that no one seems to know about. My only regret is that we don't live closer. If you've never been here, you need to check this place out.
The Food was awesome....very impressive for the value..definitely a repeat visit(s) .....

What a great find way off the beaten path. We were looking for a cozy French restaurant for dinner after seeing Hamilton on a Sunday matinee. I stumbled across Le Petit Paris on the internet and loved the old school charm it seemed to exude. I was excited and booked a reservation on open table.  We arrived a few minutes early for our reservation, so we were seated in the bar and given cocktails while we waited for our table. We were shown to our linen covered table in a few short minutes. Bread with sweet butter pats and waters were on the table when we were seated. The menu is full of traditional French dishes, and from the looks of the owner/host/chef, I would gamble that everything is done in the traditional French manner from scratch.  We started with escargots. They were tender and flavorful in a garlicy parsley butter topped with puff pastry. I had the featured lamb chops for my dinner. The herb encrusted lamb was perfectly cooked to medium rare and was accompanied by steamed fresh vegetables, roasted russet potatoes and the most delicious port wine reduction. Heaven on a plate! My dinner partner opted for the filet au poivre. The dish was accompanied with the same veg and potatoes as the lamb and was topped with a cognac peppercorn sauce with both black and red peppercorns. The filet itself was perfectly cooked to medium rare and was extremely tender and succulent. The accompanying sauce was super savory and had just the right amount of heat from the peppercorns. This was a really great dish.  For dessert, we decided to share the apple tart. When we ordered it, we were told it would be about 15-20 minutes for the tart. Why? Because they make it from scratch per order. How great is that? The tart was fresh, hot and delicious with rich buttery flavor with a hint of cinnamon to compliment the freshly sliced apples. A great ending to a great dining experience.  The prices are very reasonable. The cocktails are large. The pace is leisurely. The atmosphere is up-scale. The quality and preparation of the food is outstanding.  The owner/host was charming to us and we enjoyed the banter we had back and forth with him. This was everything I could have hoped for in a traditional French restaurant. I can’t wait for our next trip to Chicago so we can visit again. I would highly recommend Le Petit Paris.
Reasonable rendition of French classics. Pleasant dining room. Quiet.

(Translated by Google) A very pleasant evening, good food, good atmosphere, extraordinary service ... the essence of French dining. Relax, take your time, enjoy. Talk around the table. Maitre Alain is the real deal. You will not be disappointed, trust me. Unless you are expecting Old Country Buffet.  (Original) Une soireé très agréable, bonne cuisine, bonne ambiance, service extraordinaire...the essence of French dining. Relax, take your time, enjoy. Talk around the table. Maitre Alain is the real deal. You will not be disappointed, croyez-moi. Unless you are expecting Old Country Buffet.
Great place and calm atmosphere! Friendly and kind owner. Most importantly, Outstanding food! This is the best restaurant for me in downtown so far.
Don't bother if you don't know the owner
The chef is the nicest guy you'll ever meet.
Wonderfull hidden gem. Seriously authentic even down to the owner. He is so nice......as long as you are nice to him! Amazing food and very reasonable prices. Great location too.
Delicious Food. Very nice owner/chef
Hidden gem.  Excellent food, personal service, reasonable prices.
Really friendly and authentic owner
Friendly family restaurant! Very nice

This is without a doubt the most original of French restaurants in Chicago. Owner-operated, it offers original dishes in an original, if somewhat dainty surrounding. Whilst definitely worth a visit, patrons should be aware that the experience is not consistent, as wait times vary much.
(Translated by Google) A beautiful and very romantic place, with the best French food.  (Original) Un lugar hermoso y muy romántico, con la mejor comida Francesa.
Wonderful dinner with friends.  The owner is great and the food is outstanding.  We spending the whole evening feeling comfortable and well served.
Food and people were great, for great French food it's a must, decor needs updated

Let’s start with the positive: the 2 entrees we chose were excellent. But the overall dining experience was really subpar: - the service was awful (3 minutes in still no one attending us, once seated menus were literally thrown at us, we had to ask for bread as other tables of regulars got their basket right away...) - the room is really old and would need to be seriously redecorated - can you do more cheesy than Edith Piaf as musical atmosphere for a French restaurant... Theres’s some really good French contemporary music out there. - worst of all, our waiter was actually the owner himself, who was quite disdainful from the moment we said we would not order wine. We were on the verge of leaving before getting our food, but decided to look on the bright side and enjoy our meal after all. As said initially, the food itself was really good, but if you are not a regular, you will be treated like s***. Will never return.

C'est très bon -- magnifique! This is not a wine bar or brasserie. The wine selection is ample, but we would not consider it to be large. However, a nice selection of wines by the glass were only $7 each. Even at this price, the reds are all very good. The food is excellent. We are not French, but have dined many times in French households, and have visited almost all regions of France many times -- we believe the food is authentic. The chef/owner is a character! He has all the wit and energy that you might expect from a Parisian proprietor, although he is from the Paris metro area.

Great atmosphere, fabulous food and kid friendly! We made a reservation early in the day on a Saturday. We brought our kids (11 and 13) as our older son wanted to experience an authentic French restaurant. The owner greeted us from the entrance and led us to the table. He made good conversation with our kids and invited them to the bar to help him make kiddie cocktails. The kids were besides themselves! Considering how busy it gets on a Saturday night, the courses came at a perfect pace. From the bread and the appetizers (we picked the escargots, frog legs, pate, onion soup) to the entrees (file mignon au poivre, beef liver, beef tartare) and deserts (creme brûlée and chocolate mouse) everything was made to perfection. The cooking is closer to French country in my opinion, classics made as if the chef cooks for himself. We'll definitely be back!

Absolutely love this restaurant! This was our 4th or 5th time dining here. It is such a unique experience in Chicago. The food is superb and the dining experience very enjoyable. The owner is personable and takes pride in his restaurant and service to his customers. Savor all of the delicious courses, have some great wine and take your meal at a leisurely pace. You will not be rushed here and you will have to ask for the check. A true French gem!
Had a great dinner,  service was a little sub par for being under staff.
Charming. Hidden jewel
Authentic french cuisine, good service, reasonable prices, but no souffles!

Terrible experience. Rude man treated us like garbage when we came in to have dinner. I have no idea what the food tastes like as we immediately left. I reallly don’t care to eat where people disrespect me and my wife. If people bother you perhaps you shouldn’t be in the service industry.
Charming, intimate dining!  Excellent, authentic French cuisine!
Amazing food and service. Perfect French food really.  Atmosphere a bit tired.

Starting a company is stressful. In no time at all, one experiences a new, inescapable baseline level of stress. It is the stress of staring failure in the face, and never from very far, no matter what one does about it.  All I'm saying is that the (French) onion soup at Le Petit Paris cured my stress for at least the course of the dinner, and everything else was equally delightful. Five stars!

Absolutely fabulous! The food was wonderful, wine was amazing, and no one could ask for a more perfect atmosphere. The chef was so fun and personable! I will definitely be going back here anytime I am in Chicago. Merci beaucoup!!

A Google search of "restaurants near me" while staying at Westin on Michigan brought back this restaurant and I could not be more delighted that I went.  It is a quaint restaurant with a personalized level of service from the owner that is unparalleled.  The menu is well balanced and affordably priced. Everything, starters to dessert is handmade and delicious.  Wine prices are fair and liquor selection is impressive. There were six of us and we almost had an entire tour of the menu. I don't remember the last time I heard "this is so delicious" so many times within a 3 hour stretch.  I not only would recommend, I insist that you go.  I will be back.  Maybe tonite! If not, will return to CHI next month and already thinking about what to order.
(Translated by Google) Good food  (Original) Buena comida
Great food and atmosphere; will definitely go again. It was not the typical, fast-paced restaurant where you feel rushed to eat your meal. It is quite a unique find for downtown Chicago.
Special, personal, great food and presentation
The owner is a real jerk but the food is good so if you don't care about respectful service go for it
Best hidden gem in streeterville, maybe all of Chicago.

The wife made this reservation, since it popped up on open table, and is very close to lookingglass.  Wish I had known about it years ago.  Retro, traditional French food: where do you get Foie de Veau anymore?  Cooked perfectly.  One of the things I like about going to Paris is traditional​ French bistro food, and this gave me almost as good a fix.
Delicious traditional French dishes in a small restaurant run by the chef and one partner.

The food was amazing. I've eaten at most of the french restaurants in chicago, and some in Paris and Los angles - this place had by far the best frog legs- I had steak tartare also, which was excellent.  The owner was not overly friendly nor fake, but he was genuine and concerned about my dinning experience.  The prices are more than fair.  Excellent restaurant

I'm sure the food is great but we didn't even get to it.  We walk in, first thing, despite reserving a table they had to make us wait 45 minutes. We were seated at the minibar and the jukebox ate a dollar and didn't even play the songs we requested.  That's alright, we get to our table. My friend has a severe peanut and shell-fish allergy which gets triggered with even cross-contamination and she mentions this to the waitress. They send her her cheese plate and they weren't sure if the bread had traces of nuts and so we had to cancel it. The chef, an elderly man of French origin I assume come out and asked her what the problem is. She explained the allergy (which the waitress said she would translate to the chef but evidently didn't) who then makes a snarky comment saying "Sure sure now you all have the allergy, I hope you're not allergic to the food" while walking away from us and slamming the cheese plate on another table.  We decided that we didn't feel safe eating here so we told the waitress to cancel our orders and that we were going to head out. Get to the door, it's locked. Not only is that a fire hazard but extremely rude, he stops us at the front and asks us to pay for the food that hadn't even been prepped after a 45 minute initial wait and 45 mins of waiting for food and the incident I mentioned earlier. We explained to him why we wouldn't be doing that and that his treatment was extremely rude but he continued to deny that. Eventually he let us leave and we ended up going to an Italian restaurant with much better service and perhaps just as good food.  If you look at other reviews, both 1 and 5 star you'll see that weather or not the food is good, the owner/chef is extremely rude and assumptive.
Very unique near North side french with small bar and limited seating. Owner is hands on. Good plates of food . Service is good. Local " in the know" spot.

Charming French restaurant with excellent food and service. The owner was extremely friendly and you can tell he takes great pride in his menu and the preparation of your meal.  We really enjoyed our first visit here and will definitely return. One of the best French restaurants we have been to, and we have tried many.  The restaurant is in a great part of the city, but off the busier stretch near Michigan Avenue and closer to the lake. Not hard to find.
What are the best kept secrets!

The best restaurant in Chicago. Ignore the poor reviews of people who complain when they are not properly doted on. The owner is fantastic and is hilarious. All the food is locally sourced each day. When you sit to eat you are never rushed out (unless he does not like you) and you can plan on staying for 3-4 hours. This place is like a remnant of the past. The owner demands a level of respect because he has earned it, if you don't like that or your ego is too large to appreciate him then stay away, luckily you will not be welcome.

The best french restaurant in Chicago!  The service is excellent and the food is absolutely delicious.  The owner has a fabulous personality and my husband and I have dined here many times and have never been disappointed.  Just be sure to make a reservation.

French Fries came with my steak.  That's french food? Told me he was out of lamb chop and duck ... the owner , Allan, seem a bit racist.  I watch him from the bar.  Mind you, no one except me is sat in the bar.  I really didn't mind sitting there but I didn't appreciate his attitude. I hope it is my casual T-shirt or my age.  Everyone else is over 50s.  I watch the traffic as I ate my dinner. He greets everyone with smile and a few french words, but he was with me different.  He told me there was no table. He points to the floor and says " I can put table here"  in sarcasm.   I said I can sit in the bar because I didn't want any problem and was real hungry. Funny thing, more people came but he had tables for them. The rest of the dinner was more rudeness. Terrible disappointment. Also, I have never given a bad review to a restaurant, but he deserves it after he intentionally gave me that special treatment.  That is definitely not how he treated everyone in the restaurant.  I notice in Facebook that there was one other bad review,  and it was from a Japanese man.  I don't mind that he is racist.  It doesn't bother me.  I just want to post it here.  If this happens to you, you can contact me.  I will be glad to file a formal complain on him.

I called to make reservations for my daughter's birthday with our family. The manager was so incredibly rude from the start that I was stunned. He interrupted me after I was stating what time we'd like to come and  telling me to hurry up as he was busy. When I stated how unbelievably unprofessional and rude he was being, he began screaming at me stating he was "stuck working 18 hour days" and  "how dare" I say he was rude. Then he hung up on me. My daughter called back to ask for the owner who is the chef and the same man stated the owner was too busy to come to the phone. Then he stated he'd have to translate which my daughter replied " I already speak French" . He then stated "you speak American french which is terrible" and then he hung up her. So many wonderful restaurants in this gorgeous city to choose from. At this rate Le Petit Paris better change their attitude or they'll soon be out of business. Be warned...

enjoyed a quiet leisurely meal with great service and friendly owner.   Enjoyed a complimentary glass of amaretto after the meal and then left my credit card.  Called when we got back to Montana and he popped it in the mail the next day.  Great place, excellent food, our favorite meal while we spent a week in Chicago.
My favorite restaurant in Chicago! I love the atmosphere, that the staff are real people, the cozy and eclectic decor, and the delicious food.

Didn't even make it to Le Petit Paris... Reason I'm writing a review is because when I called to make a reservation, the man was extremely unpleasant to talk too. With such attitude and speaking in a derogative manner. Really interested in trying the bistro down the street but instantly turned off and away. So MANY other places you can go dine at in the best city, Chicago.

Alain is very charming as only the French can be. Both he and the cuisine  are the real deal. I have eaten there about ten times,and have never been disappointed.I have been to Paris, loved it and his establishment brings back many pleasant memories.

Le Petit Paris is a charming bistro.  The food is excellent and the service superb.  The chef and owner, Alain, is a unique gentleman. We have enjoyed dining with Alain for the past ten years and look forward to another decade of gastronomical and social pleasures!

11/21/15 - Ambience was very nice. waiter was nice and accommodating BUT food was extremely slow to prepare.  Male host was not very welcoming (bald guy of average height). Upon getting seated, I asked for a black cloth napkin and was he very short in his response of "no" with no explanation as we walk away. What fine dining restaurant does have black cloth napkins? I guess I didn't have the right not to want white lint on my black pants.  My friend had the duck which she liked although the reported it as very chewy. My rack of lamb was decent. Decent was an apple tart that like flavor but not delectable. I could have and have had better meals.  Also, the website is sad and not kept up to date with accurate content. The menu online is different than what's in the menu when you get there. In this day in age, websites are the first introduction to one's business. The owner might want to re-evaluate.  Interesting experience probably but won't return ever. Although, tipped very well, I was not impressed with the full experience and can have a better experience for what paid.
Quit and good
Charming and delightful. Left a lasting impression on me, one that when I think about I always have to smile. Best service and French cuisine in Chicago.

For many years my husband and I have enjoyed Le Petit Paris for delicious French food and for the graciousness of the owner, Alain. Since we moved back to Chicago in 2006, we have eaten at Le Petit Paris many, many times and have tried almost all the dishes on the menu. All the food is prepared and presented similar to any fantastic Paris bistro. The taste is superb! Also the wines match well with the food. Chicago is fortunate to have such a wonderful restaurant. Thank you Alain.

Le Petit is wonderful and Chef Owner Alain Sutbon is a delight.  The food is terrific and the service outstanding.  Whether it be a planned personal event or a last minute business entourage Alain is accommodating, helpful and makes the evening a complete success.
Excellent.  Very intimate.  None of the silly bells and whistles that "trendy" restaurants claim to boast.  Alain is superb at what he does.

We came on Saturday at 5:30 PM, there were only two other guest already seated. There was no on to greet us. I told the nearest waiter that we have a reservation. He pointed to a different man (lately found out that he is the owner). He came toward us, no greeting, so I repeated that we have the reservation. His answer was, "and you have a reservation without a name?" (bad joke or rudeness?) After telling him the name of reservation, he took us to a table for two. The upholstered bench was flat, empty of the upholstered filling, I was sitting lower than my wife who was sitting on a chair. A waiter with two glasses of water and the menu came quite fast. I was surprised, that in a French restaurant was no bigger selection of wine, only 3 white and 3 red wines at $7 price. Maybe, they just forgot to give us wine menu.The waiter came back to take our order, he was very nice, polite and helpful. In the middle of our conversation with the waiter, the owner came and announced that the waiter is new there and he will take our order. I remarked, that the waiter is doing very well and we are OK. The owner, obviously upset without a word turned around and left. We saw later that the owner was very unpleasant to our waiter. The waiting for our food, even there were not too many guests was very long. The escargot were fantastic, my rack of lamb were very taste, but cold. My wife filet mignon was OK. Wine was just so-so. Within almost 1.5 hours there, we had no time to peruse dessert menu. Even waiting for the check was too long. The owner stopped paying attention to us, and there was nobody to thank us for coming and say good by!? They will not see us there anymore. I hope that our waiter will keep his job.

We have been here many times and love it. The atmosphere is a little quirky but that is part of the charm. The food is consistently good. We have had a to wait for a table on weekend nights even with a reservation but otherwise the service is quite good.
A hidden gem in Chicago...

I was recently introduced to Chef Alain a week and a half ago by a friend, and found him to be a Chef who is truly interested in serving the freshest of food.  He was perplexed about some customer who was extremely upset that he ran out of an item.  He gets produce daily, and orders quantities of meat and fish so that they are fresh when cooked.  I had a wonderful rack of lamb, and it was the last one he had that night.  Then I log into Google and read the last reviewer who was upset about running out of an item.  Put two and two together and you get .....  I have met a lot of restaurant owners who find themselves in a difficult position at this point this winter.  Between the snow, the cold and the economy, business is so slow, I mean really, really slow, that it is a struggle to maintain quality of the food and quality of the service that is easy to maintain when you have a healthy flow of customers.  Every successful restaurant is a successful collaboration of its customers and the establishment, it owners and staff.  When the weather and the economy warms up, I think all of the small business owners will be a lot less crabby.  In the meantime, Le Petit Paris is a great place for Valentine's Day weekend and on any other day because the food is fresh and reservations are plentiful.  Relax and enjoy yourself!

TERRIBLE service. Mediocre food at best. Chef Alain is verbally abusive to his customers. Unless you order an appetizer, main course and wine, he does not feel your presence is worth his time. Food is not as described (snails do not come baked in puff pastry) and if he is out of a food item, well, that's your fault, too. Spend the extra money to take a taxi to another French restaurant - Le Bouchon, Chez Joel, Bistrot Margot...Le Petit Paris should be last on your list.

A romantic hidden find, with authentic delicious french cuisine. Le Petit Paris is a little hard to find, it's found in the lobby of an apartment building, right by the lakefront. It's a place where you would least expect to bring a dinner date but it will definitely leave you with a memorable experience.  The atmosphere is enchanting to say the least. It's a small little place, about 10 tables on the first floor and a few more on the smaller second floor. It's dimly lit with orange lights and when you are greeted at the door by the french owner, you immediately feel like you're in Paris. He has such flair and flamboyance, which makes you feel at ease and relaxed. But this is only the start.  As your evening goes on, the place grows on you and when the food comes, oh my! I had the Escargots Bourguignon and Boeuf Bourguignon. Both were simply astounding. The escargots were done in a puff pastry, which was light, airy and fluffy. The escargots themselves were perfectly cooked, tender and juicy with each mouthful. The mint sauce that it was in complemented the dish wonderfully. A great appetizer to start my meal.  After that, the beef was served. At first glance, it did look a tad small, but what it lack in quantity, it more than made up in quality. The beef was so tender that I did not need a knife to cut it. Just a light touch with my fork, and the beef was falling all over the place. Needless to say when it entered my mouth, no chewing was necessary. It simply melted away, providing my tastebuds with delightful flavor and texture. I could go on and on to describe the beef but it wouldn't do it justice. All I can really say is for you to give it a try for yourself and experience it.  For the quality of food and atmosphere it provides, the prices are reasonable. If you're looking for a quiet place, a romantic dinner over masterfully cooked french food, this is the place to be at.

What a delight! Although there was only one person to do absolutely everything (wait tables, tend bar, bus tables, etc), the service was not especially slow, and it was very personal. The place is small, intimate, and very attractive with dark wood paneling and bronze chandeliers. Everyone was very friendly. Food was authentic, good hearty cuisine and prices were very reasonable, including wine. I recommend it very highly!
Outstanding!!!!   Extremely personable knowledgeable owner, wonderful food and wine pairings.
